alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 11:39AM EST until further notice by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River and Tippecanoe River. .Rain, heavy at times, is expected to move into the region tonight and continue through Thursday. Total rainfall amounts of over two inches are expected. This rainfall in addition to snow melt will lead to flooding along area rivers. Lowland and minor flooding is expected in most locations, with moderate flooding possible along parts of the upper Wabash. Another system early next week could lengthen the amount of time in flood and make the flooding worse than currently forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Covington. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Basement flooding begins in 10 to 12 cottages. The approach to new bridge downstream of SR 28 in Attica floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 23.7 feet Monday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued by late this evening.
